data.name: Scott Bader
data.description:
Scott Bader is an employee-owned global manufacturer of advanced composites, structural adhesives and functional polymers. Established in 1921, we have a century of expertise in manufacturing high-quality, innovative products for a variety of markets around the world. Scott Bader now employs 800 people across 7 manufacturing sites and 18 offices worldwide.

Scott Bader is committed to expanding its global reach, with recent ventures including North America, India, Japan, and Australia, while continuing to build on its reputation for innovation, outstanding quality and technical expertise.

Click here to see the industry shows you can visit Scott Bader at this year:

https://www.scottbader.com/dates-for-your-diary/

data.name: Crystic
data.description: Crystic® Resins have been developing for over 70 years to meet your application needs.

data.name: Texicryl
data.description: Texicryl® emulsion used to enhance the workability and technical performance of products being supplied into the building and decoration market.A diverse range of thickeners and binders for the Artist Colors market. It can also be used in water-based styrene acrylic emulsion polymers and solid resins specifically developed for graphic art applications, as a rheology modifiers for Hand Cleanser applications.With over 60 years’ experience, our range of PVA / acrylic binders and inverse emulsion thickeners deliver high performance in textile and furnishing products.

data.name: Crestomer
data.description: Crestomer®  adhesives are used in a wide range of demanding applications in a variety of markets. The key features and benefits for customers are structural adhesives, considerable weight savings versus traditional GRP joining techniques, excellent impact and fatigue performance and low VOC emissions.

data.name: Crestapol
data.description: Crestapol® intelligent resin technology is a series of low viscosity urethane acrylate based resins designed for infusion, pultrusion and closed mold applications.

data.name: Crestamould
data.description: High performance matched tooling systems

data.name: Crestafix
data.description: Crestafix bonding pastes are used in a wide range of applications, in a variety of markets. The key features and benefits to customers are wide range of densities, low shrinkage, range of working times, ease of application and color change.

data.name: Texipol
data.description: Scott Bader’s Texipol® range of rheology modifiers can be used in a variety of water-based formulations.A diverse range of thickeners and binders for the Artist Colors market.Texicryl® and Texipol® emulsions to enhance the workability and technical performance of products being supplied into the building and decoration market.With over 60 years’ experience, our range of PVA / acrylic binders and inverse emulsion thickeners deliver high performance in textile and furnishing products.

properties.name: INCI Name
items: Prunus Amygdalus Dulcis (Sweet Almond) Shell Powder

data.name: Texipol 63-513
data.description: Texipol 63-513 is a next generation inverse emulsion synthetic thickener based on a significant proportion of bio-derived content. It imparts pseudoplastic rheology to aqueous compositions and is supplied as a pre-neutralized dispersion, as the sodium salt of an acrylic based polymer. Texipol 63-513 shows broad pH compatibility.

data.name: Crestapol® 1260 Urethane Acrylate Resin
data.description: Crestapol® 1260 Urethane Acrylate Resin is a low-viscosity urethane acrylate type resin. It is suitable for infusion, resin transfer molding (RTM), and similar processes at room temperature. This product can be infused at vacuum levels down to -1.0 bar. It produces laminates with high strength, toughness, and exceptional water and hydrolysis resistance.

data.name: Texicryl® 13-602
data.description: Texicryl® 13-602 is a styrene acrylic copolymer emulsion designed for use in flexible fillers, caulks, sealant applications and architectural coatings. It enhances the workability and technical performance of many products. It meets all environmental demands, such as low VOC, APEO-free and formaldehyde-free with no compromise on quality and performance.

data.name: Crestakyd® 10-1066
data.description: Crestakyd® 10-1066 is a fast drying alkyd that has excellent brushability and flow characteristics, as well as good gloss retention and weathering resistance. This long oil air drying alkyd can be used for economical decorative and do-it-yourself paints, including primers, topcoats, and varnishes.

data.name: Texicryl® 13-812
data.description: Texicryl® 13-812 is an alkali swellable emulsion designed for water-based printing ink formulations. It has excellent rub resistance and transfer properties. It is designed for use in flexographic inks for corrugated board. It is also suitable as a pigment grinding medium and let down vehicle.

data.name: Texipol 63-510
data.description: Texipol 63-510 is an inverse emulsion thickener that imparts a highly pseudoplastic rheology to aqueous based compositions. It is supplied as a pre-neutralized dispersion, as the sodium salt of an acrylic copolymer and shows thickening over a very wide pH range of 2 - 12.

data.name: Crystic® Vinyl Ester Resin VE679-03PA
data.description: Crystic® Vinyl Ester Resin VE679-03PA is a pre-accelerated, DCPD modified, vinyl ester resin developed for use as a infusion resin with a wide range of gel times with various catalysts. It has excellent blister resistance and significantly reduces the occurrence of print through, to produce durable moldings with an enhanced surface finish.

data.name: Texicryl® 13-503
data.description: Texicryl® 13-503 is a styrene acrylic copolymer emulsion designed for the formulation of printing inks for application to non absorbent, low surface energy substrates. It is used in the formulation of printing inks for substrates such as polyethylene, polypropylene and various foils.

data.name: Texicryl® 13-217
data.description: Texicryl® 13-217 is an APEO free self-crosslinking acrylic copolymer emulsion characterised by a soft film giving, after crosslinking, a high resistance to washing and to primed or printed fabrics. It is ideal for the manufacturing of non woven fabrics and as flocking adhesive by spraying, in full bath or by foaming.

data.seo_description: Scott Bader is an employee-owned global manufacturer of advanced composites, structural adhesives and functional polymers. Established in 1921, we have a century of expertise in manufacturing high-qua

featured_products.name: Crestabond® M1-05 Structural Adhesive
featured_products.description: Crestabond® M1-05 Structural Adhesive is a toughened, two-component 10:1 MMA structural adhesive that is designed for bonding a wide range of substrates.

featured_products.name: Crestabond® M1-60HV/2 Structural Adhesive
featured_products.description: Crestabond® M1-60HV/2 is a toughened, two-component 10:1 acrylic adhesive designed for bonding composites, thermoplastics, and metals.

featured_products.name: Crestomer® 1152PA Structural Adhesive
featured_products.description: Crestomer® 1152PA Structural Adhesive provides high performance and is designed for demanding applications. Greatly reduces styrene emissions, and it improves cosmetics.

featured_products.name: Crystic® Vinyl Ester Resin VE 679PA
featured_products.description: Crystic® Vinyl Ester Resin VE 679PA is a pre-accelerated, thixotropic, DCPD modified, vinyl ester laminating and tooling resin with excellent surface finish.

featured_products.name: Crestapol® 1250 Urethane Acrylate Resin
featured_products.description: Crestapol® 1250 Urethane Acrylate Resin is a low-viscosity urethane acrylate resin. It's designed for maximum wet out for pultruding fiberglass, carbon fiber, and other fibers

featured_products.name: Texique® HE10
featured_products.description: Texique® HE10 is a new bio-based high performance thickener for the personal care market. It is produced from 62% naturally derived ingredients, none of which are animal-based

featured_products.name: Texique® CS-32
featured_products.description: Texique® CS-32 is an aqueous solution of a naturally derived cationic polysaccharide produced from food grade potato starch that has not been genetically modified.

featured_products.name: Texique® CS-P
featured_products.description: Texique® CS-P is an easy to use modified film forming cationic starch derivative, produced from food grade potato starch that has not been genetically modified.

featured_products.name: Crestafire® GCS 1005PA
featured_products.description: Crestafire® GCS 1005PA is a pre-accelerated, low smoke fire retardant intumescent polyester-based gelcoat designed to be applied by spray in a thin layer of 500µm.

data.name: Crestakyd
data.html_description: High performance alkyds designed to provide the right balance of esthetic, protective and application properties for paints and coatings.
data.text_description: High performance alkyds designed to provide the right balance of esthetic, protective and application properties for paints and coatings.
data.seo_title: Crestakyd - Scott Bader - Alkyd Paints - Protective Coatings
data.seo_description: View all Scott Bader Crestakyd products on Knowde.com. Quickly and easily request a quote, get samples, and download data sheets.

data.name: Crestakyd® 10-1066
data.description: Crestakyd® 10-1066 is a fast drying alkyd that has excellent brushability and flow characteristics, as well as good gloss retention and weathering resistance. This long oil air drying alkyd can be used for economical decorative and do-it-yourself paints, including primers, topcoats, and varnishes.

data.name: Crestakyd® 30-5005
data.description: Crestakyd® 30-5005 is short oil fast drying alkyd resin with high hardness. It is an essential paint and coating component, offering excellent durability, good flow and leveling properties. This short oil air drying alkyd is used in air drying primers and finishes, metal and wood application.

data.name: Crestakyd® 30-5067
data.description: Crestakyd® 30-5067 is a fast drying short oil alkyd supplied in xylene for use in airdry and force-dry primers and topcoats. It is recommended for use in air-dry and force-dry primers and topcoats in a variety of general industrial metal coating applications.

data.name: Crestakyd® 41-5009
data.description: Crestakyd® 41-5009 is a styrene-modified alkyd based upon a blend of mixed non-yellowing oils and supplied as a solution in xylene. It is a very versatile resin that gives paints with high gloss and good resistance properties. It is also used in the marine industry for quick drying coatings.

data.name: Crestakyd® 10-1022
data.description: Crestakyd® 10-1022 is a fast drying alkyd that has excellent brushability and flow characteristics, as well as good gloss retention and weathering resistance. This long oil air drying alkyd can be used for economical decorative and do-it-yourself paints, including primers, topcoats, and varnishes.

data.name: Crestakyd® 10-2023
data.description: Crestakyd® 10-2023 is a high-solid iso-phtalic, has excellent brushability and flow characteristics, as well as weathering resistance. It is recommended for the production of low VOC exterior paints and wood stains, impregnations. It is also compatible with conventional long oil alkyds and thixotropic resins and can be used in combination to improve the solids of the resultant paint.

data.name: Crestakyd® 10-2033
data.description: Crestakyd® 10-2033 is a fast drying alkyd that has excellent brushability and flow characteristics, as well as good gloss retention and weathering resistance. This long oil air drying alkyd can be used for economical decorative and D.I.Y house paints, including primers, topcoats and varnishes. It has good compatibility with “universal” colorants.

data.name: Crestakyd® 10-2505
data.description: Crestakyd® 10-2505 is a fast drying alkyd that has excellent brushability and flow characteristics, as well as good gloss retention and weathering resistance. This long oil air drying alkyd can be used for economical decorative and do-it-yourself paints, including primers, topcoats, and varnishes.

data.name: Crestakyd® 10-3507
data.description: Crestakyd® 10-3507 is a high solids, fast drying alkyd that has excellent brushability and flow characteristics, as well as good gloss retention and weathering resistance. This top quality, long oil alkyd can be used for decorative gloss paints and varnishes.

data.name: Crestakyd® 20-5024
data.description: Crestakyd® 20-5024 exhibits rapid initial and through drying characteristics and gives excellent gloss and good weathering resistance / color stability. This medium oil air drying alkyd can be used for air drying and low bake industrial finishes and vehicle refinishes.

data.name: Crestakyd® 20-5029
data.description: Crestakyd® 20-5029 is a rapid drying alkyd that has excellent gloss / weathering resistance and flow characteristics. This chain stopped, medium oil air drying alkyd is an essential paint and coating component, offering excellent durability, good flow and leveling properties. It can specifically be used for primers, general air dry industrial finishes and machinery enamels.

data.name: Crestakyd® 20-5036
data.description: Crestakyd® 20-5036 is a chain stopped alkyd with excellent drying, gloss and weathering properties. This chain stopped, medium oil is an essential paint and coating component, offering excellent durability, good flow and leveling properties. It can specifically be used for primers, general air dry industrial finishes and machinery enamels.

data.name: Crestakyd® 20-9021
data.description: Crestakyd® 20-9021 is a rapid drying alkyd that has excellent gloss / weathering resistance and flow characteristics. This medium oil air drying component is an economical chain stopped alkyd used for fast drying machinery enamels, primers and other air-dry industrial finishes.

data.name: Crestakyd® 20-9074
data.description: Crestakyd® 20-9074 is a rapid drying alkyd that has excellent gloss / weathering resistance and flow characteristics. This medium oil air drying alkyd can be used for primers and other air-dry industrial finishes. It is an essential paint and coating component, offering excellent durability, good flow and leveling properties.

data.name: Crestakyd® 20-9509
data.description: Crestakyd® 20-9509 is a high solids, medium oil alkyd based on linoleic rich fatty acids supplied in butyl acetate and designed for use in wood coating finishes. It has been designed for use in high solids acid curing finishes for wood. Coating systems based on this resin exhibit fast cure, excellent pot-life and good wet heat resistance.

data.name: Crestakyd® 30-5016
data.description: Crestakyd® 30-5016 is a chain stopped alkyd for rapid air drying industrial paints and low bake enamels with excellent resistance to oils, greases and water. It is suitable for use in vehicle and machinery finishes, can be air-dried, force-dried or stoved. Air drying finishes are tack free in 30 minutes with good through drying properties. Crestakyd® 30-5016 has excellent resistance to oils, greases and water.

data.name: Crestakyd® 30-5049
data.description: Crestakyd® 30-5049 is a short oil alkyd based on linoleic rich fatty acids supplied in xylene and designed for use in wood coating applications. It has been designed for use in acid curing finishes for wood. This resin provides excellent cold check properties, good wet heat resistance, good stackability and excellent all round properties.

data.name: Crestakyd® 30-5057
data.description: Crestakyd® 30-5057 is a rapid solvent release alkyd that has high stability and good cold check test. It is an essential paint and coating component, offering excellent durability, good flow and leveling properties. This wood finishing, short oil alkyd can be used for easy sanding nitrocellulose sealers and finishes.

data.name: Crestakyd® 30-5068
data.description: Crestakyd® 30-5068 exhibits rapid drying characteristics and fast hardness development. It has very good weather resistance, excellent film build and attractive gloss. It can be used for NC finishes, acid hardening finishes and in combination with low reactivity melamine resins for industrial stoving enamels and automotive finishes.

data.name: Crestakyd® 30-5071
data.description: Crestakyd® 30-5071 exhibits rapid drying characteristics and fast hardness development. It has very good weather resistance, excellent film build and attractive gloss. It can be used for NC finishes, acid hardening finishes and in combination with low reactivity melamine resins for industrial stoving enamels and automotive finishes.

data.name: Crestakyd® 30-9055
data.description: Crestakyd® 30-9055 is a rapid solvent release alkyd that has high stability and good cold check test. It is an essential paint and coating component, offering excellent durability, good flow and leveling properties. This short oil alkyd can be used for easy sanding NC sealers and NC finishes.

data.name: Crestakyd® 30-9502
data.description: Crestakyd® 30-9502 is a short oil, high solids, chain-stopped alkyd based upon linoleic-rich fatty acids, supplied in a 3:2 w/w blend of xylene / methoxy propanol. The high solids allow this product to be formulated in VOC compliant topcoats (max. 420 g/l) and DTM primers, both displaying excellent salt spray resistance.

data.name: Crestakyd® 41-6010
data.description: Crestakyd® 41-6010 is a universally employed resin in primers, enamels and hammer finishes. It is suitable for air dry, low bake and general purpose stoving industrial paints. The resin is compatible with urea and melamine formaldehyde resins and is therefore suitable for stoving finishes.

data.name: Crestakyd® 44-5027
data.description: Crestakyd® 44-5027 is a short oil alkyd with phenolic resin and rosin modification. It exhibits rapid initial and through drying and high resistance to water, fuels and oil. This modified air drying alkyd has good flexibility and adhesion to metallic substrates.

data.name: Crestakyd® 10-3000
data.description: Crestakyd® 10-3000 is an air drying alkyd that has excellent brushability and flow characteristics, as well as good gloss retention and weathering resistance. It is used for interior and exterior decorative enamels, marine and topside paints. Also suitable for undercoats, maintenance primers and floor varnishes.

data.name: Crestakyd® 44-5043
data.description: Crestakyd® 44-5043 is a linoleic/wood oil alkyd modified with both rosin and phenolic. It is supplied as a 60% non-volatile solution in xylene. It has been designed for use in fast drying industrial primer applications with excellent adhesion and resistance to corrosion.

data.name: Crestakyd® 10-4007
data.description: Crestakyd® 10-4007 is an air drying alkyd that has excellent brushability and flow characteristics, as well as good gloss retention and weathering resistance. It has been specifically formulated for use in artist's paints and for applications requiring higher flash points.

data.name: Crestakyd® 10-1019
data.description: Crestakyd® 10-1019 is a fast drying alkyd that has excellent brushability and flow characteristics, as well as good gloss retention and weathering resistance. This long oil air drying alkyd can be used for economical decorative and do-it-yourself paints, including primers, topcoats, and varnishes.

data.name: Crestakyd® 10-1025
data.description: Crestakyd® 10-1025 is a fast drying alkyd that has excellent brushability and flow characteristics, as well as good gloss retention and weathering resistance. This long oil air drying alkyd can be used for economical decorative and do-it-yourself paints, including primers, topcoats, and varnishes.

data.name: Crestakyd® 10-2020
data.description: Crestakyd® 10-2020 is a fast drying alkyd that has excellent brushability and flow characteristics, as well as good gloss retention and weathering resistance. This long oil air drying alkyd can be used for economical decorative and do-it-yourself paints, including primers, topcoats, and varnishes.

Scott Bader is an employee-owned global manufacturer of advanced composites, structural adhesives and functional polymers. Established in 1921, we have a century of expertise in manufacturing high-quality, innovative products for a variety of markets around the world. Scott Bader now employs 800 people across 7 manufacturing sites and 18 offices worldwide.

Scott Bader is committed to expanding its global reach, with recent ventures including North America, India, Japan, and Australia, while continuing to build on its reputation for innovation, outstanding quality and technical expertise.

WHY_CHEMISTRY.HEADING: Driving the world's most impactful industry forward.

SECTION_1.DESCRIPTION: At Knowde, we believe in the power of chemistry. We believe that easy and efficient access to information and raw materials enables you to work smarter and faster so you can continue to make a rich global impact.

SECTION_2.DESCRIPTION: Your innovations have decreased the carbon footprint of the automotive industry, imagined a sustainable agricultural future, developed alternative, biodegradable packaging materials, and changed the landscape of connectivity forever – to name a few. This is only the beginning.
SECTION_2.HEADING: We can't wait to see what you create with Knowde.

ROW.TITLE: Knowde Software

0.TITLE: Knowde for Suppliers
0.DESCRIPTION: Transform how customers discover, engage and transact with you online with turnkey solutions for ingredient, polymer and chemical suppliers.

1.TITLE: Knowde for Distributors
1.DESCRIPTION: Delight both your principals and your customers with a modern online experience that differentiates your brand and accelerates business growth.

0.TITLE: Master Data Management Platform
0.DESCRIPTION: Digital transformation begins with clean data. Knowde organizes your structured product data in a matter of weeks.

1.TITLE: Customer Experience Application
1.DESCRIPTION: Knowde's turnkey application enables you to deliver an incredible customer experience on your website and turns it into a growth tool for your sales team.

2.TITLE: Knowde Marketplace
2.DESCRIPTION: Join the fastest growing marketplace for ingredients, polymers and chemicals. Get started for free!

TOOLTIP.TITLE: Why is this important?
TOOLTIP.PARAGRAPH_I: Knowde is a B2B platform where customers and suppliers conduct business online. Using a business email address demonstrates the legitimacy of your company and commercial intent, and you are much more likely to receive responses to your requests.
TOOLTIP.PARAGRAPH_II: You can still use a personal email but you may have additional company verification steps before getting access to all of {companyName}'s features.

FLAVOR_ANALYZER.HEADER: Need a flavor that’s not in our online PRIMETIME catalog?
FLAVOR_ANALYZER.DISCOVER_FLAVORS: Tap into our expansive offline portfolio of over 500,000 flavors! Our Portfolio Team can assist in identifying the perfect flavor for your needs. Tell us more about what you’re looking for.

PAYWALL.TITLE_1: Get new products to market faster with a free Knowde Marketplace account
PAYWALL.DESCRIPTION_1: Gain instant access to our marketplace of over 250,000 chemicals, ingredients and polymers from 8,000 suppliers. Browse, search, and filter to quickly compare products, find information, request documents, order samples, and get quotes directly from suppliers.
PAYWALL.TITLE_2: The fastest way to find the right raw materials for your products
PAYWALL.DESCRIPTION_2: Search and filter over 250,000 chemicals, ingredients and polymers, access documents and download starter formulations. Interact with over 8,000 suppliers whose representatives are ready to help. Sign up for a free Knowde Marketplace account today.
PAYWALL.DESCRIPTION_3: Create a free account to gain instant access to our marketplace of over 250,000 products and their documents.
